poem:
**The Call**

In the quiet hum of dawn,  
a phone, forsaken, rings—  
echoes of a voice never heard  
in empty lows.  

A tarpaulin drapes hope,  
concealing the unsaid—  
yet beneath,  
the earth whispers its truth,  
strangers exchange  
sorrow for silence.  

War's breath,  
a hollow wind  
through the shattering  
cracks of morning.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Reckoning review – shattering stories of invasion in Ukraine During the violent chaos following the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, a woman whose husband is missing receives a phone call from his number. Brief relief implodes when the speaker is not him but a stranger revealing that this device has been found beside a corpse covered by a tarpaulin. This is one of numerous shattering anecdotes in a play by Dash Arts,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Reckoning review – shattering stories of invasion in Ukraine During the violent chaos following the Russian invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, a woman whose husband is missing receives a phone call from his number. Brief relief implodes when the speaker is not him but a stranger revealing that this device has been found beside a corpse covered by a tarpaulin. This is one of numerous shattering anecdotes in a play by Dash Arts,
